metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: XPath Examples
Let's try to learn some basic XPath syntax by looking at some examples.
content.html: Let's try to learn some basic XPath syntax by looking at some examples.

content.text: The XML Example Document
We will use the following XML document in the examples below.
content.html: We will use the following XML document in the examples below.

content.text: "books.xml":

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>


<bookstore>


<book category="cooking">


<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>


<author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>


<year>2005</year>


<price>30.00</price>

</book>


<book category="children">


<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>


<author>J K. Rowling</author>


<year>2005</year>


<price>29.99</price>

</book>


<book category="web">


<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>


<author>James McGovern</author>


<author>Per Bothner</author>


<author>Kurt Cagle</author>


<author>James Linn</author>


<author>Vaidyanathan Nagarajan</author>


<year>2003</year>


<price>49.99</price>

</book>


<book category="web">


<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>


<author>Erik T. Ray</author>


<year>2003</year>


<price>39.95</price>

</book>


</bookstore>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<bookstore>

<book category="cooking">
  <title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
  <author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>
  <year>2005</year>
  <price>30.00</price>
</book>

<book category="children">
  <title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
  <author>J K. Rowling</author>
  <year>2005</year>
  <price>29.99</price>
</book>

<book category="web">
  <title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>
  <author>James McGovern</author>
  <author>Per Bothner</author>
  <author>Kurt Cagle</author>
  <author>James Linn</author>
  <author>Vaidyanathan Nagarajan</author>
  <year>2003</year>
  <price>49.99</price>
</book>

<book category="web">
  <title lang="en">Learning XML</title>
  <author>Erik T. Ray</author>
  <year>2003</year>
  <price>39.95</price>
</book>

</bookstore>

links.text: View the "books.xml" file in your browser

content.text: View the "books.xml" file in your browser .
content.html: View the "books.xml" file in your browser.

content.text: Loading the XML Document
Using an XMLHttpRequest object to load XML documents is supported in all modern browsers.
content.html: Using an XMLHttpRequest object to load XML documents is supported in all modern browsers.

content.code_html: var xmlhttp = new XMLHttpRequest();

content.text: Selecting Nodes
Unfortunately, there are different ways of dealing with XPath in different browsers.
content.html: Unfortunately, there are different ways of dealing with XPath in different browsers.

content.text: Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Opera, and Safari use the evaluate() method to select nodes:
content.html: Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Opera, and Safari use the evaluate() method to select nodes:

content.code_html: xmlDoc.evaluate(xpath, xmlDoc, null, XPathResult.ANY_TYPE,null);

content.text: Internet Explorer uses the selectNodes() method to select node:
content.html: Internet Explorer uses the selectNodes() method to select node:

content.text: In our examples we have included code that should work with most major browsers.
content.html: In our examples we have included code that should work with most major browsers.
